met.name: Met
met.description2: Any robot who's spent time on the battlefield will recognize this popular Mecha! The infamous Met, otherwise referred to as the Metool, Mettal, Mettaur, was originally designed for construction and mining assistance, but later came to be repurposed and utilized for any sort of task. As such, there are many varieties and 'species' of Mets, but the one seen here is the most basic of them all. Protected by a hardhat-like ceratanium shell, the Met will annoyingly surprise attack any who draw near.
met.skill_description: The active robot's stats are boosted around other hardhats
met.skill_description2: The active robot's stats are boosted by one stage when it notices another hardhat on the field.

sniper-joe.name: Sniper Joe
sniper-joe.description2: One of the few humanoid-based Mechas, the Sniper Joe was a mass-produced military model designed by the genius minds of Drs. Light and Wily, based heavily on the schematics of the prior Proto Man.  The large shields that Sniper Joe bring into battle protect them from nearly all damage, but they can be reliably knocked-off with a sufficiently charged buster shot or a weapon of either the Explode or Impact variety.  More inventive in its programming than any other Mecha, the Sniper Joe is advanced enough to enact adaptable strategy routines, wield shields and firepower, or command vehicles. Despite there being thousands of this model, they are indeed all named 'Joe.'
sniper-joe.skill_description: Starts battles with a shield that blocks damage
sniper-joe.skill_description2: The robot starts battles with a shield that blocks virtually all damage. Only charged attacks can remove it.

skeleton-joe.name: Skeleton Joe
skeleton-joe.description2: Dr. Wily's own personal take on the mass-produced Sniper Joe (if it wasn't obvious), the Skeleton Joe is relatively composed of very few parts, and thus excelled in being widely produced and distributed for tactical defenses. After being struck, the Skeleton Joe will dismantle and reassemble with frustrating ease, so they must be completely destroyed in one hit to be removed.  It's also worth noting that the Skeleton Joes will remove segments of their own body to throw at their opposition.
skeleton-joe.skill_description: Fully restores life energy at the end of the turn
skeleton-joe.skill_description2: The robot puts itself back together at the end of each turn to restore depleted energy.  Only OHKOs can stop it.

crystal-joe.name: Crystal Joe
crystal-joe.description2: Outfitted with a miniaturized variant of Crystal Man's own crystalline-counterfeiting generator, the Sniper Joe model was the only Mecha series advanced enough to assist in Dr. Wily's gem-profiteering scheme. As a defect to their carbon-forging prowess, they lack the traditional offensive and maneuverability options found in their siblings. And so to Dr. Wily's chagrin, they simply starting using their highly valuable gemstones as ammunition instead.
crystal-joe.skill_description2: The robot shields itself with a single-use crystal between turns.  Only multi-strike moves can break through.

flea.name: Flea
flea.description2: The Flea series was an unsuccessful model of crop-dusting robot designed to resemble a cricket. Prior to reprogramming Dr. Light’s first set of Robot Masters, Dr. Wily bought several hundred Fleas wholesale and modified them as close-combat units for his mechanical legions.

picket-man.name: Picket Man
picket-man.description2: Similar in appearance to the Met, the Picket Man series is a general-purpose labor robot. In addition to a handheld ceratanium shield, they are equipped with a high-frequency pickaxe capable of breaking down the hardest of rocks.

peng.name: Peng
peng.description2: The Peng series is a flying, penguin-like robot engineered to explore polar regions. The heat from their solar reactors is conducted throughout their bodies to prevent their internal systems from stalling in subzero temperatures.

bombomb.name: Bombomb
bombomb.description2: The Bombomb line was originally produced for military usage, but due to an excess supply of ammunition, surplus commodities were sent to civil sectors to be used as demolition for antiquated buildings. With the advanced robotics and the creation of Robot Masters, however, the Bombombs quickly became relegated to relics of the past.
bombomb.skill_description: The robot deals Explode type damage without resistance
bombomb.skill_description2: The robot has one job and it intends to do it right, dealing Explode type damage without regard to any resistances.

tackle-fire.name: Tackle Fire
tackle-fire.description2: The Tackle Fire series, originally dubbed the Changkey, are living fireball robots capable of generating temperatures up to 1500°C. A single Tackle Fire can melt through steel with ease.

spine.name: Spine
spine.description2: The Spine series is a low-lying security robot that travels back and forth to obstruct intruders. Spines are highly resilient, and any attack that does not critically damage them will only knock their systems offline for several seconds.

flutter-fly.name: Flutter Fly
flutter-fly.description2: The Flutter Fly series was created alongside Time Man as part of a short-lived partnership between Light Labs and the Chronos Institute. Like Time Man himself, Dr. Wily stole most of the incomplete Flutter Flies and reprogrammed them for combat shortly after his first defeat.

beetle-borg.name: Beetle Borg
beetle-borg.description2: The Beetle Borg series was built to monitor environmental conditions near industrial sites. Much like the dung beetle, Beetle Borgs will roll their soil samples into small spheres for easy transportation. Despite the Beetle Borg's rudimentary design, its AI is actually quite complex for its time.

pierrobot.name: Pierrobot
pierrobot.description2: The Pierrobot series were originally performers for the Robot Circus before Dr. Wily forcibly recruited them into his robot army. In battle, a Pierrobot will rely on its acrobatic skills and the surrounding environment to gain an advantage over its foes.
pierrobot.skill_description: Afflicts the active target with a Cutter weakness when face-to-face
pierrobot.skill_description2: The robot afflicts the active target with a weakness to Cutter-type moves when standing face-to-face.

fan-fiend.name: Fan Fiend
fan-fiend.description2: The Fan Fiend series use their powerful chest-mounted fans to clean city streets. Dr. Wily used the Fan Fiend as the basis for Air Man, and several served under the windy Robot Master during Wily’s own bid for world domination.

snapper.name: Snapper
snapper.description2: The Snapper series was designed to explore the deepest parts of the ocean floor, especially the Marianas Trench. In order to resist the intense water pressure of these areas, Snappers are outfitted with a specialized Pyrex coating.

spring-head.name: Spring Head
spring-head.description2: Dr. Wily created the Spring Head series as a perimeter security robot for his various installations, using programming from scrapped Spines. When a Spring Head detects an intruder, it will rush toward them to deliver a spring-powered head-butt capable of knocking a human out cold.

killer-bullet.name: Killer Bullet
killer-bullet.description2: The Killer Bullet series is a sentient missile used in demolition and mining. As a consequence of their self-destructive nature, the use of Killer Bullets has become a hot-button issue for pro-robot rights groups.

crazy-cannon.name: Crazy Cannon
crazy-cannon.description2: Based on an unused security robot design, Dr. Wily outfitted each unit of the Crazy Cannon series with a weaker variant of the Tachyon Capacitor used in the construction of Flash Man. Said capacitor allows the Crazy Cannon to fire quantum energy shots faster than the speed of light.

telly.name: Telly
telly.description2: The Telly series was built for security and police work in urban areas. Their photoreceptors house a pair of high-definition security cameras, as well as thermal and night vision systems. While most Tellies have limited offensive capabilities, Dr. Wily has installed flamethrower similar to Heat Man’s Atomic Fire system on some of his stolen units.

batton.name: Batton
batton.description2: The Batton series serve as wardens for nature preserves and parks. Scientists have used Battons to study rare and elusive species up-close without disturbing their habitats. At one point, they were highly sought after as pets.
batton.skill_description: Boosts the Nature-type field multiplier every turn
batton.skill_description2: The robot boosts the Nature-type field multiplier at the end of each turn in an effort to restore balance.

needle-ned.name: Needle Ned
needle-ned.description2: Much like Needle Man himself, the Needle Ned series was developed to work in mines. Patterned after a hedgehog, they can roll into a ball to break through large blockages. Their conical projectiles can pierce through up to ten feet of stone and are especially effective against crystalline structures.

mag-fly.name: Mag Fly
mag-fly.description2: The Mag Fly series is used in warehouses, docks, and scrapyards across the word. Their powerful electromagnets can haul up to 200 kilograms of cargo.”
mag-fly.skill_description: The robot might attract screws at the end of the turn
mag-fly.skill_description2: The robot's magnetic body has a chance of attracting small to large screws at the end of each turn.

nitron-r.name: Nitron R
nitron-r.description2: The Nitron series is a military robot used to bombard targets into submission from low altitudes. While most Nitrons use a potent mixture of nitroglycerin (hence their name), rumor has it that Dr. Wily has installed cryogenic mines and electrostatic generators on his units.
nitron-r.skill_description: Boosts the Flame-type field multiplier every turn
nitron-r.skill_description2: The robot triggers chemical reactions within to boost the Flame-type field multiplier at the end of each turn.

nitron-b.name: Nitron B
nitron-b.description2: The Nitron series is a military robot used to bombard targets into submission from low altitudes. While most Nitrons use a potent mixture of nitroglycerin (hence their name), rumor has it that Dr. Wily has installed cryogenic mines and electrostatic generators on his units.
nitron-b.skill_description: Boosts the Freeze-type field multiplier every turn
nitron-b.skill_description2: The robot triggers chemical reactions within to boost the Freeze-type field multiplier at the end of each turn.

nitron-y.name: Nitron Y
nitron-y.description2: The Nitron series is a military robot used to bombard targets into submission from low altitudes. While most Nitrons use a potent mixture of nitroglycerin (hence their name), rumor has it that Dr. Wily has installed cryogenic mines and electrostatic generators on his units.
nitron-y.skill_description: Boosts the Electric-type field multiplier every turn
nitron-y.skill_description2: The robot triggers chemical reactions within to boost the Electric-type field multiplier at the end of each turn.

monking-r.name: Monking R
monking-r.description2: The Monking R series was originally built to survey jungles, rainforests, and other thickly-wooded regions. Their hands and feet are equipped with adhesive palms and soles that allow them to attach themselves to trees while mapping terrain. Impressed by this ability, Drs. Light and Wily used several Monking Rs to monitor safety conditions in their mining facilities.

spin-fiend.name: Spin Fiend
spin-fiend.description2: Following his second defeat at the hands of Mega Man, Dr. Wily was left with dozens of destroyed Fan Fiends. As a result, he used their components to create the Spin Fiend series, capable of firing top-shaped projectiles from their chest cavities.
spin-fiend.skill_description: Boosts all stats when Wind core robots are on the field
spin-fiend.skill_description2: The robot has negative feelings about its creation, causing it to boost its own stats when around Wind cores.

petit-snakey.name: Petit Snakey
petit-snakey.description2: Dr. Wily developed the Petit Snakey series to guard Snake Man’s lair at the Serpent Columns. Their highly modular design led Wily to create several varieties, including the gargantuan Big Snakey.

elec-n.name: Elec'n
elec-n.description2: The Elec’n series was created to maintain power plants and electrical substations. They can plug into any electrical system to recharge themselves.

ribbitron.name: Ribbitron
ribbitron.description2: Modeled after a frog, the Ribitron series is an upgrade of the earlier Flea series. Dr. Wily outfitted them with thicker armor to make them more resilient, sacrificing jump height in the process.

bulb-blaster.name: Bulb Blaster
bulb-blaster.description2: Each model of the Bulb Blaster series houses a 100-watt lamp. Their uses are varied, from providing light to impoverished communities to guiding rescue workers through collapsed buildings.

robo-fishtot.name: Robo Fishtot
robo-fishtot.description2: The Robot Fishtot series is used to maintain the sewage systems of major cities. The grinders inside their oversized maws allow them to ‘chew’ through clogged pipes with ease.
robo-fishtot.skill_description: The robot neutralizes hazardous material at the end of the turn
robo-fishtot.skill_description2: The robot cleans up hazardous materials at the end of each turn in an effort to curb water pollution.

drill-mole.name: Drill Mole
drill-mole.description2: The Drill Mole series is capable of tunneling through solid bedrock, leading them to be employed for mining and construction. Due to their small size, they operate in swarms when excavating large areas.
drill-mole.skill_description: Allows the robot to dig up elemental shards during battle
drill-mole.skill_description2: The robot intermittently drills the ground below its feet looking for elemental shards hidden below.

pyre-fly.name: Pyre Fly
pyre-fly.description2: The Egyptian government contracted Dr. Cossack to design the Pyre Fly series to aid Pharaoh Man in protecting ancient ruins from grave robbers and armed insurgents. Their audiovisual sensors are linked directly to Pharaoh Man’s, allowing him to spot intruders long before they reach his wards.

ring-ring.name: Ring Ring
ring-ring.description2: The Ring Ring series were created as companions and assistants for astronauts on deep-space voyages. Their internal gyroscopes allow them to remain stable and upright in zero-g environments.
ring-ring.skill_description: The robot disables hazardous explosives at the end of the turn
ring-ring.skill_description2: The robot disarms nearby explosives at the end of each turn in an effort to keep things peaceful.

lady-blader.name: Lady Blader
lady-blader.description2: Unlike earlier Blader models, the Lady Blader series can be carried to safety by a short-distance jet engine if their propellers are damaged or detached. Thus, said propellers can be launched offensively, with the Lady Blader’s jet holding it aloft until another can be installed.

manta-missile.name: Manta Missile
manta-missile.description2: Patterned after a stingray, the Manta Missile is an aquatic take on the Killer Bullet. They are commonly used in offshore drilling operations, using sonar to track down the planet’s diminishing fossil fuel deposit.
manta-missile.skill_description: Boosts the robot's attack on Water-type fields
manta-missile.skill_description2: The robot's attack stat is boosted by one stage at the end of each turn when the Water-type field multiplier is high.

skullmet.name: Skullmet
skullmet.description2: The Skullmet series is an automated anti-infantry cannon designed for urban warfare. Their small size allows them to maneuver through crowded city streets, and their armored hides can revisit most conventional firearms. However, a shot through their lightly-armored photoreceptors can deal significant damage to their internal systems.

flipping-suzy.name: Flipping Suzy
flipping-suzy.description2: This 'Suzy-G' model is a high-tech variant of the classic Adhering Suzy mecha, preinstalled with a functional (and pricey) gravity apparatus. Despite this, however, its gravity capabilities are still quite lacking.

bui-boi.name: Bui Boi
bui-boi.description2: Though many may mistake this mecha as a simple ocean buoy, the Bui Boi mecha actually utilizes sophisticated radar technology to keep an eye on any invading enemy threats. Its offensive capabilities aren't really much to speak of, but it'll nevertheless do its best to get you to crash and wipe out!

rockscotch.name: Rockscotch
rockscotch.description2: The Rockscotch are mechas that were created for the use of cut-and-cover tunnels, collecting gravel and minerals to be moved aside during construction. Despite the calm look in their eyes, they're quite hard-headed.
rockscotch.skill_description: Reduces the cost of its team's Earth-type abilities to only one unit
rockscotch.skill_description2: The robot's stockpile of piled rocks reduce the cost of its team's Earth-type abilities to only one unit.

krushdiver.name: Krushdiver
krushdiver.description2: One could probably try to decipher a functional application for this mecha, but quite frankly, the Kouker Q is really only interested in trying to give a certain unsuspecting blue bomber a splitting headache. It can often be found hovering around high altitudes, where it'll then stall its engines to plunge down and take its foe down with it.
krushdiver.skill_description: The robot deals Cutter type damage without resistance
krushdiver.skill_description2: The robot's giant spikes can pierce through anything, dealing Cutter type damage without regard to resistances.

novamite.name: Novamite
novamite.description2: The Novamite was an early design of Dr. Light's that had trouble securing funding, and even then was ultimately ever produced in small quantities for both interstellar and aquatic purposes. This variant excels in clearing out asteroids and space debris for space travel, but given they're unable to handle their own discharges, it's no wonder funding was so hard to come by...
novamite.skill_description: The robot recovers lost health by lowering its defense after each turn
novamite.skill_description2: The robot perseveres by restoring it own life energy between turns but does so by sacrificing its defense.

mouslider.name: Mouslider
mouslider.description2: The Mouslider series are mobile animal mechas that were created by Dr. Wily to be able to seek out and monitor Mega Man from any nook or cranny. They slide using voltage strips built into their rubber bumpers, but as an unforeseen side effect, it makes their underside hysterically ticklish.
mouslider.skill_description: Afflicts the active target with a Swift weakness when face-to-face
mouslider.skill_description2: The robot afflicts the active target with a weakness to Swift-type moves when standing face-to-face.

bombardier.name: Bombardier
bombardier.description2: Bombardier is a small-scale military combat bomber based upon the schematics of the Bombier mecha, carrying a payload of three air-to-ground torpedoes. What if it misses, you ask? It then hopes no one noticed, and hightails it out of the battlefield.

pukapunter.name: Pukapunter
pukapunter.description2: Pukapunter's head is continually propelled and kept afloat through the usage of a miniature thermodynamic vent installed within its main body. Having to balance its own head makes for a constant juggling act though, and in its sheer determination, it often ends up running and bumping into its own allies.

curlinger.name: Curlinger
curlinger.description2: Curlinger was an advancement in the sport of curling, acting as both a curling stone and a computerized referee. They're not programmed to understand combat, so they just simple-mindedly slide across icy surfaces. If they get caught between walls, they're an awful lot of fun to watch.

kabuton.name: Kabuton
kabuton.description2: Kabuton is modeled after the hercules beetle, meant to embody their natural strength and fortitude. They come in both helicopter and jet-engine variants, and hide within the branches of trees, dropping down only to charge headfirst into any unsuspecting passer-bys. Unless that happens to be a Batabattan mecha - they make good friends!

colton.name: Colton
colton.description2: Quick on the draw, Colton's got six shots in the gun chamber for the next set of buckaroos unlucky enough to make their way to his town. Well, to be honest, the Coltons were really just made to fill out as cheap extras in Western movies - but they're real good method actors.

ben-k.name: Ben K
ben-k.description2: Modeled after the great Japanese warrior Saito Musashibo Benkei, it's often played the role of gate guards or sentries in many Japanese dramas and plays. The Ben K travels far and wide, collecting the weapons of the greatest warriors out there to add its own personal collection.
ben-k.skill_description: Boosts the robot's attack upon disabling a target
ben-k.skill_description2: For every enemy this mecha beats, it automatically boosts their attack stat every time.

gockroach-s.name: Gockroach S
gockroach-s.description2: These little insect mechas were based off of the coackroaches in Dr. Wily's prison cell, the only friends he had. He loved them so much he wanted to sell Gockroaches for people all around the world to enjoy. These mechas aren't that tough, but they like to pick up trash and scrap to make up large Gockroach nests.

parabeak.name: Parabeak
parabeak.description2: From the ranks of Wily's army, this bird-like mecha enjoys traveling in attack formation flocks to chase off intruders in its territory. They're brave enough in a clique, but when alone, it's too socially anxious to do anything.
parabeak.skill_description: The mecha's stats is boosted when it feels confident with its friends.
parabeak.skill_description2: All of these Mecha's stats are boosted when other Wind-core robots are there to help it out.

coiln.name: Coil'n
coiln.description2: This mecha follows in the example of its hero Spring Man, and lives only to bounce around rooms in pure freedom. Hitting anyone is purely accidental. The Coil'n is terrified of children, which is a shame because kids love them.

eggalodon.name: Eggalodon
eggalodon.description2: This little newborn mecha hangs out in its shell, all snug and comfy before the battle begins. Once an enemy appears, it finally cracks out to start its biting and chasing! They're quite feisty, so don't feel bad about punting the little guys.

cline.name: Cline
cline.description2: The Cline is modeled after the dragons of Chinese mythology, set for fearsome battle in high altitudes above. Its tail segments are for intimidation, and in actuality, destroying these will only allow the Cline to travel even faster.
cline.skill_description: Drastically boosts the robot's attack when in danger
cline.skill_description2: The mecha's speed stat is increased to its maximum whenever it's in critical condition.

plasma-plus.name: Plasma Plus
plasma-plus.description2: This mecha, or rather mechas, work in tandem to flow and converge an electrical pulse in between the both of them to both manage power production and to block off restricted areas or access-ways. If one is destroyed, the electrical current is completely lost, so it actually has to spend its energy rebuilding its twin.
plasma-plus.skill_description: Reduces the cost of its team's Electric-type abilities to only one unit
plasma-plus.skill_description2: The mecha's combined electrical current reduces the cost of its team's Electric-type abilities to only one unit.

oni-robo.name: Oni Robo
oni-robo.description2: Also known as the devious Typhoon Goro mecha, the Oni Robo revels in getting together in gangs to harass and bother innocent people. Knowledgable enough to work wind-powered machinery, the Oni Robo once had a bright future ahead of it, but it seems it settled for becoming a delinquent.
oni-robo.skill_description: The robot's attack stat is boosted when other shadow-core robots are nearby
oni-robo.skill_description2: The robot's attack stat is fired up and ready for violence when others of its core-type are nearby.

romper.name: Romper
romper.description2: The Rompers believe there is strength in numbers - this is because they're only about a foot tall. They can often be found in circuses and carnivals picking up work. Some Rompers who attack people have a tendency of stealing their zenny. This is because of a gambling addiction.

quotes.battle_victory: Ron - pazu, ronpazu, pazu, ron - pazu, ronpazu!

octone.name: Octone
octone.description2: This mechanized cephalopod was developed by Light Labs to defend fragile ecosystems - they hide within large potted vases, and when intruders wander in, they fling out and spurt ink fluid! It's not really much in terms of damage, but it's just excruciating to wash out of fabric.

diaymon.name: Diaymon
diaymon.description2: Diaymon is a floating diamond-shaped mecha originally built by Jewel Man to keep him company in the Gemstone Cavern, though these days they can occasionally be found in other glitzy locations.  These mecha come in a wide variety of beautiful colours, but their flashy exteriors house resilient cores that protect them from OHKOs.  Further, the Diaymon have the innate ability to convert elemental energy into crystalline shards within their own bodies.  They generally don't like to do this though, as it requires being hit with elemental energy in the first place!  It may seem like a big ask, but try to be gentle with the Diaymon - despite the name they're actually kind of soft!

petal-anne.name: Petal Anne
petal-anne.description2: A dancer with a hint of danger - that's Petal Anne, the happy, dancing little flower mecha. A popular theory within the agricultural scientific community these days is that sound stimulates plant growth - and so, designed by Dr. Pedro Astil, the petite Petal Anne spends all day singing and dancing for all its flower friends. Dr. Wily had its rhythmic motors lined to a spike-arm when he repurposed it, but without that - feel free to just dance with it!

adamski.name: Adamski
adamski.description2: This lightweight and inexpensive mecha was developed by Light Laboratories as a planetary rover designed for interstellar travel and surface exploration. They're able to efficiently take in crust samples such as dust, rocks, and liquids, though you'll note that they utilize the same proprietary tech used in Dr. Wily's hovercraft - this means they're excruciating to listen to.

frosty-throwman.name: Frosty Throwman
frosty-throwman.description2: The 'head' on this mecha is only just a snowball - the Frosty Throwman is actually the body compartment underneath, which generates stored snow up on top. It then sets an explosive into the snowball it throws to surprise opponents. It's great at snowball fights, but longs for the day it can make a snow angel.

pointan.name: Pointan
pointan.description2: Compiled from wireless and wired junk data, Pointan is a mouse cursor enemy that roams and hides out in the vast digital network. They often disguise themselves and hide out in people's PCs, so trust no cursor - not even your own.

pitchan.name: Pitchan
pitchan.description2: Capable of high-rate fastballs and curveballs, Pitchan provides excellent batting training for beginning and advanced Baseball players alike. Strangely enough, its programming has a weird tendency to miscalculate and hurt players batting for rival teams.

sola-rei.name: Sola Rei
sola-rei.description2: Ingeniously, the mecha modeled after a sunflower, Sola Rei, contains the ability to slowly gather and charge solar energy into a highly potent beam of energy! Theoretically, given enough advancements in solar harvesting, if the Sola Rei was able to efficiently utilize 100% of the sun's energy, its beam could melt through planets.

air-stone.name: Air Stone
air-stone.description2: Using high-tech optical camouflage, this security mecha lies in wait for intruders to trespass, where it'll then pop off a shower of rock-hard bullets! That being said, optical technology isn't all that perfect - if you can spot the cloaking technology, it'll be easy to avoid it at a distance.
air-stone.skill_description: The robot deals Earth type damage without resistance
air-stone.skill_description2: The robot seeks to catch the opponent by surprise, dealing Earth type damage without regard to any resistances.

shimobey.name: Shimobey
shimobey.description2: An actor robot used in hero shows as the evil foot soldier. Dreaming of someday playing the hero, it always tries to look its best as the heroes beat it up.

pipetto.name: Pipetto
pipetto.description2: A chemical mixing robot that excels at precisely measuring out fluid. Each spurt of toxic chemicals it launches out is exactly 2000ml. Imperial-system Pipettos instead dish out attacks at about 67.63 ounces.
pipetto.skill_description: Boosts the Water-type field multiplier every turn
pipetto.skill_description2: The robot boosts the Water-type field multiplier at the end of each turn.

arc-weldy.name: Arc Weldy
arc-weldy.description2: Due to a slightly cheaper CPU, Arc Weldy doesn't really care about defeating Mega Man, it just wants to weld all day. It's a nice enough little robot, but you can't help but wonder about that sad look in its eyes...

tamp.name: Tamp
tamp.description2: The Tamp are a remarkably heavy mecha given that were created to help with the transport of oversized space equipment, but their teleportation capabilities make their weight a non-issue all things considered.  When Dr. Wily reprogrammed them, he gave the Tamp orders to crush any Mega Man than encounter by warping above his head and then crashing down.  Oddly enough, despite being mass-produced only one Tamp has actually been spotted in wild.

covercannon.name: Covercannon
covercannon.description2: These Covercannons were present during the initial stages of the infamous Stardroid invasion of Earth. They hide firing artillery from afar, then jump out to surprise enemies coming in hot. They seem a lot like Mets - maybe they're cousins?

biribaree.name: Biribaree
biribaree.description2: Biribaree served within the ranks of the Stardroids' army when they invaded Earth, charging up intense amounts of electricity before firing off a bolt of electricity. This mecha has a sibling series called Piriparee - if ever the two brothers were together, they'd be capable of generating a short circuit powerful enough to cause a global energy crisis!

fooley.name: Fooley
fooley.description2: Fooley's a powerful mecha that belongs to the Stardroids' army. It looks unassuming, but with the power of its pendulum building up as it goes back and forth, it unleashes a mighty temporal field that completely slows down time not unlike Time Man's ability.
fooley.skill_description: Boosts the Time-type field multiplier every turn
fooley.skill_description2: As its pendulum swings, the robot boosts the Time-type field multiplier at the end of each turn.

beak.name: Beak
beak.description2: The Beak series is an automated turret gun, so named for their beak-like ceratanium cladding. They are often employed to guard military installations and munitions depots.

shield-attacker.name: Shield Attacker
shield-attacker.description2: The Shield Attacker series of mechas are flying enemies that are indestructible from the front.  While originally used purely as defensive shields, they were later modified for combat.

adhering-suzy.name: Adhering Suzy
adhering-suzy.description2: This barrier mecha was designed to monitor and watch over dangerous locations. Though small, they're able to cover a lot of ground by moving surface to surface. As always, the weakness for enemies like this is their eye.

big-eye.name: Big Eye
big-eye.description2: Any mecha expert would know better than to catch the gaze of the Big Eye - this colossal monstrosity was a special favorite of Dr. Wily's, serving as security robots meant to catch and crush any outsiders. The Big Eye's hide is almost nigh-impenetrable - its only weakness is the eye module present on its body.
big-eye.skill_description: The robot deals Impact type damage without resistance
big-eye.skill_description2: The robot has one job and it intends to do it right, dealing Impact type damage without regard to any resistances.

foot-holder.name: Foot Holder
foot-holder.description2: When Dr. Wily began his first go at world domination, he cherished the ingeniously-designed Foot Holders for their usefulness in transporting heavy cargo across vast distances and chasms. They were, in fact, so good at their jobs that they accidentally helped carry Mega Man across all of Wily's meticulously designed traps and lairs. They are now on Dr. Wily's list of officially-banned mechas.

power-muscler.name: Power Muscler
power-muscler.description2: Dr. Wily was a big fan of shōnen manga when he was young, so Power Muscler was actually inspired by the hero in some of his favorites. They were first used for the construction of Wily's fortresses, which he had started doubling up on at this point, but of course he repurposed them afterwards to destroy Mega Man.

weapon-archivist.name: Weapon Archivist
weapon-archivist.description2: Weapon Archivists hail from the aptly-named Weapons Archive, a facility built by Dr. Wily and integrated into one of his legendary castles during the crescendo of the Wily Wars.  Put simply, the Weapons Archive is a room with all the Special Weapon data from all the Robot Masters that the doctor had encountered up until that point in history.  The Weapon Archivists, acting as multifaceted battle blocks and protectors of the facility, would fly toward any intruders and attack them with the weapon of one Robot Master.  In their original configuration, the Weapon Archivists fought in teams of three and remained within the room itself, but here in Prototype they appear to have multiplied and spread to locations far beyond their origin domain.  Fortunately, whenever a Weapon Archivist takes on the powers of a robot master it also takes on their weaknesses, allowing would-be victims to fight back and maybe even knock some cores out of them.

heal-bot.name: Heal-Bot
heal-bot.description2: These Heal-Bots were developed and meant to act as little helpful hackers around the Prototype, maintaining and upkeeping the servers of the Prototype. Unfortunately, due to the recent disturbances, they've become scattered and lost all throughout the digital world, and without their support, bugs have begun to form and pop up across the Prototype. They're very cheery creatures, though awfully familiar, right?

heel-bot.name: Heel-Bot
heel-bot.description2: These poor Heal-Bots seem to have been corrupted - so, most likely, Dr. Wily's handiwork. The Heel-Bots appear to feature all the same capabilities of their sibling Heal-Bots, though curiously their healing matrixes have been completely destabilized and fried. They're nowhere near as innocent, either; they can be seen loitering, leaving shopping carts in the  parking lot, and not using their turn signals when turning. In other words, absolute evil.

trille-bot.name: Trille-Bot
trille-bot.description2: It is unclear as to whether these floating sentries are a modification of the original Heal-Bot design, an upgrade to the hijacked Heel-Bot line, or something new entirely.  What is known is that the Trille-Bot possess an incredible amount of alien energy brimming within their cores.  Trille-Bot rarely attack their target directly, instead opting to support their master from the bench with healing, stat boosts, and other assistive measures.  Despite lacking a visible mouth, these support mecha still manage to convey a tale of sadness through their eyes.
